byline.contributor: Mariana Simões contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and Paula Moura and Jill Langlois from São Paulo, Brazil.

abstract: Scores of protesters flood city streets across Brazil, reasserting calls for Pres Dilma Rousseff to step down amid sweeping political scandal and sputtering economy.
lead_paragraph: Though protests seemed to lack the urgency of earlier demonstrations, tens of thousands returned to the streets of cities across Brazil to express their displeasure with President Dilma Rousseff.

headline.main: Protests Across Brazil Raise Pressure on President Dilma Rousseff
headline.print_headline: Brazilians Return to Streets to Urge Rousseff’s Ouster

snippet: Though protests seemed to lack the urgency of earlier demonstrations, tens of thousands returned to the streets of cities across Brazil to express their displeasure with President Dilma Rousseff.
